sentences.en: A little adolescent rebellion is commonly believed to be healthy.
sentences.cn: 大家一致认为，青少年有点叛逆是正常的。

sentences.en: Amy sewed with outward meekness and inward rebellion till dusk.
sentences.cn: 阿密阳奉阴违地一直缝到黄昏.

sentences.en: I would have thought it a proper job for the Army to fight rebellion.
sentences.cn: 我会认为派军队去平叛是恰当之举。

sentences.en: In the book she wrote of the Taiping Rebellion.
sentences.cn: 在这本书里,她写到了太平天国的事.

sentences.en: It directed my loyalties to the side of men in rebellion.
sentences.cn: 它把我的赤诚之心引导到反抗着的人们这方面来了.

sentences.en: It roused a feeling of rebellion in him.
Oppression provoked the people to rebellion.
Rock is the music of teenage rebellion.
sentences.cn: 摇摆乐是青少年的反叛音乐.

sentences.en: The colonel was able to orchestrate a rebellion from inside an army jail.
sentences.cn: 这位上校得以在军队监狱里策动了一场哗变。

sentences.en: The crew were ready for rebellion openly.
The masses are in rebellion and one's friends are deserting.
The reintroduction of conscription sparked off a major rebellion.
sentences.cn: 再次征兵引发了一次大规模的暴乱.

sentences.en: Too rigid parental control fosters rebellion in children.
sentences.cn: 父母管教过严会促使子女反抗.

sentences.en: What was he getting out of rebellion?
sentences.cn: 他从反叛中得到了 什么 ?

words.tran_cn: 反抗的；造反的；难控制的

trans.tran_en: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence
